title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand protesters gathered at Boston Common against Trump's immigration policy, enduring 15-degree weather and snow.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and other groups, aligning with nationwide demonstrations.
Protesters marched to the State House while Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band performed on the steps.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are considering an infield trade before the 2026 season starts, focusing on defensive upgrades.
Possible trade targets include Isaac Paredes from Houston and Nico Hoerner from the Cubs for infield improvement.
Boston might use Marcelo Mayer at third and split second base duties between Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye's father, Mark, expressed surprise at the Patriots' unexpected run to Super Bowl LX.
The Patriots improved their record to 14-3, led by quarterback Drake Maye's standout season.
Drake Maye's family, including his brother traveling from Japan, plans to attend Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will announce Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks for NBC.
This will mark Collinsworth's sixth Super Bowl broadcast involving the Patriots, including their 2015 win over the Seahawks.
Collinsworth previously called three pivotal Patriots games this season with NBC, observing their offensive and defensive evolution.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Snowplow driver Matte McGarry saved a man trapped in a snowbank in Auburn during a recent snowstorm.
The man had fallen headfirst into a deep snowbank while walking home and was unable to free himself.
McGarry is set to receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his life-saving actions.

title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: UMass Amherst student Kivlighan de Montebello sues the university over a one-year suspension for organizing a protest.
The protest during a career fair targeted RTX's recruitment efforts due to the company's involvement in providing military technology to Israel.
The lawsuit claims the suspension violates free speech rights and calls for a jury trial, damages, and expungement of the record.

title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Four preteens were identified after allegedly assaulting a vehicle near the scene of a fatal attack in Providence.
The juveniles, aged 11 to 12, were charged with murder in the beating death of Rony Alonso on January 19.
Charges were upgraded to murder after Alonso died from blunt force trauma; arraignment occurred in Family Court.

title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer at Allandale Farm in Jamaica Plain, died peacefully in his paddock Tuesday night.
Curtis's death comes less than a year after the passing of his brother, Willard, both brought to the farm in 2008.
Allandale Farm will announce a celebration of life for Curtis, inviting public memories and photographs on their website.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox have discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder, focusing on pitching depth for trades.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval also involved in trade talks, indicating interest in shifting pitchers.
Red Sox linked to infielders Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez this offseason.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: K'Lavon Chaisson, Patriots linebacker, plans to re-sign with New England in free agency after a standout season.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks and 18 QB hits, playing a key role in the Patriots' defensive success this year.
He praises coordinators Josh McDaniels and Zak Kuhr for their roles in the Patriots' Super Bowl run.
